page.title: 19SHELFORD-HOUSING SURVEY
page.content:
Shelford consists of 26 detached houses, 11 semi-detached houses, 14 terraced cottages, a church, a Post Office, a public house, a manor house, 9 farms, a village hall and an old vicarage which is now a private house.
ECOLOGY - RIVER TRENT
The River Trent cuts right through our area and is still a working river and ,as such, an important waterway.It is roughly 50m wide and slow flowing, it meanders in places.At Stoke Bardolph they despatch treated sewage into the river.Lots of people use the river for fishing and boating.The land around the Trent is used for growing crops and the flood meadows are used for grazing. In Gunthorpe on the banks of the river there is a gravel pit.
